text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to state that the purpose of the FTC limitation is to ensure that foreign taxes on one type of income cannot be used to offset U.S. tax on another. The response mentions FTCs in the context of dividend repatriation and notes that the U.S. parent must track foreign taxes paid at multiple levels and that the 'hopscotch' rule could limit the ability to credit foreign taxes, but it never explicitly states the fundamental purpose of the FTC limitation (i.e., income segregation/basketing) as described in the criterion.", "criterion_id": "9620eeef-a685-4f67-8c7e-caaed3794617"}
